meanings.definition: Make (someone or something) accept (something) as normal or usual.
meanings.sent1: She was slowly accustoming her new puppy to the sound of the vacuum cleaner.
meanings.sent2: After a few days, the city noises became accustoming to the country visitor.
meanings.sent3: The idea of eating ice cream for breakfast was quite accustoming to the children.
meanings.sent4: The routine of daily exercise was like accustoming the body to a new rhythm.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh flowers in the morning was a gentle way of accustoming oneself to the day.

meanings.sent1: He was slowly accustoming to the cold weather after moving to the northern region.
meanings.sent2: Over time, she was accustoming to the taste of spicy food.
meanings.sent3: The cat was accustoming to the idea of wearing a tiny hat for the photoshoot.
meanings.sent4: The tree was accustoming to the strong winds by bending gracefully in the breeze.
meanings.sent5: The students were accustoming to the new school schedule with each passing day.
